job_Description: This position is located in the Division of Data, Analytics, Research and Evaluation (DARE), within the Economic Security Administration (ESA) at the Department of Human Services (DHS) and reports to the Chief Research and Evaluation Officer. ESA is responsible for administering public assistance programs in the District of Columbia, including but not limited to Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF), Medical Assistance (MA), and Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). Candidates for this position are expected to be experts in data science and predictive analytics with an understanding of how to apply data science tools to answer important questions about public assistance programs and anti-poverty measures. Candidates are expected to provide leadership and direction to a team that identifies, designs, and executes various quantitative studies and data science projects for ESA to improve the quality of services provided to the district residents.       Duties and Responsibilities       Candidates are required to lead routine and ad-hoc statistical and predictive analyses, involving big data and multiple databases residing in different platforms. Candidates will conduct analyses and create reports to ensure ESA and its divisions remain compliant with federal and local regulations. Candidates will provide ongoing support to ESA, working with program staff to reduce errors, increase efficiencies, and improve the customer experience. Candidates will need to be strategic thinkers, capable of problem-solving, identifying solutions, and effectively communicating recommended actions.       The candidate will create and update data reports and dashboards, monitor key measures for programs like SNAP and TANF, and visualize data to inform decision making. The candidate will provide technical assistance to the agency’s leadership in interpreting and utilizing data. The candidate will support program staff in tracking, understanding, and utilizing data. Candidates will provide the framework for ESA to adopt and implement advanced data science methods and techniques, including machine learning. Candidates will promote a data-driven decision-making culture across the agency by learning about the data needs ESA divisions and providing data and analytical findings to program staff and leadership on a routine basis.       The candidate will be required to interpret findings from data analyses and develop concrete recommendations for how to improve ESA programs, policies and operations. The candidate will participate in the development of policy proposals and conduct complex analyses of anticipated effects of legislation on programs and services (e.g., cost-benefit analysis, caseload projection, and impact analysis). Candidates will research and monitor various economic and social indicators relevant to District residents and human services. Candidates will be required to visualize data using programs like Tableau, Excel, and Python for use in data dashboards, fact sheets, research briefs, and other publications.       The candidate will work closely with IT staff to support system enhancements on behalf of program staff. The candidate will work with the agency’s eligibility system report writers and vendors to develop and improve data reports and data accuracy.       The candidate will perform exploratory data analysis and identify meaningful patterns and relationships within the data. Candidates will lead and manage data analysis projects, including designing studies, identifying data sources, compiling and cleaning data, analyzing and visualizing findings, writing reports, and presenting and developing recommendations. The candidate will be required to use SQL, Tableau, and Microstrategy to analyze and visualize data for various monitoring and reporting activities across ESA programs and divisions. The candidate will use machine learning to identify ways that ESA can increase efficiencies and improve customer service.       The candidate is expected to perform the above responsibilities using various data science techniques and statistical analysis tools, including but not limited to the following:             Descriptive and inferential statistics, predictive analytics, machine learning, and prescriptive analysis        Intuitive and compelling charts and infographics to visualize data effectively        Statistical analysis tools, such as R, Python, SPSS, STATA, etc.        Geo-spatial analysis using GIS tools such as ArcView        Business Intelligence (BI) and visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Microstrategy, as well as Microsoft Excel        Data mart and data warehouse, relational databases, Microsoft Access and SQL        SurveyMonkey and Qualtrics            Qualifications and Education       Bachelor's degree in Behavioral or Social Science; or related disciplines appropriate to the position.  or  Combination of education and experience that provided the applicant with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.  or  Four years (4) of appropriate experience that demonstrated that the applicant has acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.       Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lowest grade level in the line of progression. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the line of work of the position and has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position.       Selective Placement Factor       Qualified applicants must have demonstrated experience and proficiency in more than (1) of the following data science tools Python, SQL, R, etc. to carry out machine learning and predictive analytics.       Licenses and Certifications       None       Work Environment       The work is primarily performed in the normal office setting.       Other Significant Facts       Note: Work samples may be requested, and applicants may also receive a written assessment as part of the interview process.       Tour of Duty:  Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.       Promotion Potential:  None       Collective Bargaining Unit:  This position is not covered under a collective bargaining agreement.       Pay Plan, Series and Grade : CS-0101-13       Position Designation:  This position has been deemed Security Sensitive under the guideline of the DC Personnel Manual. Incumbents of this position are subject to enhanced suitability screening pursuant to Chapter 4 of DC personnel regulations. Accordingly, incumbents must successfully pass a criminal background and consumer credit check as a condition of employment and will be subject to periodic criminal background checks for the duration of their tenure.       Vaccination Requirement:  The Government of the District of Columbia values the safety of our employees, our residents, and our visitors. In support of these values, if you are selected for this job you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, which includes all eligible booster shots, except when vaccination is not medically advised or violates your sincerely held religious beliefs in violation of EEO laws. If you are invited to join our team, you must submit proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to your initial HR representative, or you must request an exemption from your representative. New employees must either provide proof of vaccination or be granted a medical or religious exemption before working with the Government of the District of Columbia.       EEO Statement:  The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, matriculation, physical handicap, or political affiliation.
